Body:
I am currently using the AT&T IoT Starter kit, equipped with FRDM-K64F development board w/ cellular shield attached. I am using this kit to subscribe to a MQTT protocol via AWS and I am running into some issues. I successfully connect the first time, but then after a few seconds the connection is lost and when it reconnects it will either reconnect successfully or give me the following error (see link below)

Error1

After it attempts to reconnect a few times the following error shows up
column9:
which I think means there is no more RAM on the board and as a result there is no input.(see link below)

Error2

Can someone please help me figure why it cannot maintain a connection? It says tls handshake error
column10:
could it be a issue with the certificates? I'm at a loss.

EDIT: Looks like the pictures don't work so here are the errors

1.Error: failed

   !mbedtls_ssl_handshake returned 0x1.

The other two errors it gives after attempting connection a few times is

2.Error: failed 

   !mbedtls_ssl_setup returned 0x7f00

and

3.Error: failed 

   !mbedtls_ssl_write returned 0x7100
"

Body: @blt	So sometimes the connection is successful on the first try and sometimes it is not. It will attempt to reconnect and sometimes it will result in a successful connect or it does not. After a few seconds it disconnects and goes into a cycle of attempting to reconnect until it finally gives the last two errors.
It's not clear from the logs whether the initial connection was successful. You need to configure AWS IoT with your certificate and a policy for the TLS connection to succeed.
Please do not post pictures of error messages, they are hard to read and not searchable.. Post the actual text and use the tool bar to format it.
